intro: Pterichis sagittata, commonly known as the arrowleaf pterichis, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners in suitable climates.
